People are being over-dramatic about season 8.

The Balance team actually AREN'T incompetent.
They go off invisible data and trends 3rd party API sites dont have and every buff or nerf is extensively tested internally over the course of a few weeks rather than being last minute write ups (they bust out excel sheets and everything to make sure buffs land as close as possible to the mark). behind all controversial balancing changes there is a ulterior motive the public might not know about which looks out for the interest of the company as a whole rather than just calming the playerbase .
The reason most changes fall flat on their face is because the sheer amount of global games played  post patch daily cannot compare to the 30 or so playtest games that happen over the course of the week internally so Riot cant catch certain elements before its too late. In a way however this also Riots best method of testing changes. simply tossing things into live and using live servers as a labrat.

In addition to this the playtest/balance team feels the same ways as the playerbase about the current state of the game but they cant just snap their fingers and fix everything magically. From Solving the trainwreck that is Runes to  making more Reworks and VGUs for champions and even developing a more satisfying item pool that satiates all manners of builds and keeps every class and manner of gameplay satisfied and viable.

These things take time,resources and man power of which the team is limited not to mention league being in a declining state combined with a bureaucratic approach to changes only make matters all the more fickle..

Or.... maybe the balance team really is full of monkeys and bronzies who never shoulda hired GhostCrawler!

Ahri's design is the most balanced in the game (numerically she may be strong or weak, but her kit design is balanced).

Honestly, not even kidding, that's my opinion.

She has a good mix of targeted damage and skillshots, which means she has to land skillshots to really perform but is not entirely worthless if she misses them.
